Understate: The claim underestimates the impact of the health care law by stating that the only impact for people with insurance is that their insurance is stronger, better, and more secure.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are still more than 20 provisions of the Affordable Care Act that have yet to take effect, which may have an impact on people with insurance.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all implementation issues and changes brought by the health care law would not affect the majority of Americans who already have health insurance.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations to the claim, such as higher taxes and potential changes in health care providers accepting Medicaid or Medicare.
